address: 29 E 30th St, New York, NY 10016, United States
name: The Crooked Knife

reviews.review: Made reservations for Brunch on a Saturday and was able to be seated immediately. Service was super friendly thanks to our waiter Alicia. Food came out fast and everything tasted great exactly what I wanted for breakfast. Now the real best

This place and service was horrible. I came for my friends birthday for brunch, she made a reservation in advance, and when we got here, they forced 9 of us to sit outside at a small table. After asking if there was anyway for us to be

The service was good and courteous but very slow. As many other businesses they are short of staff so the waiters are super busy.I got the avocado toast and it was delicious, eggs were cooked perfectly.
Great staff. Came in for a few drinks. Was checked on routinely. Check them out! Very cool place to relax and have a bite or drink

I will not be returning to the crooked knife because I got FOOD POISONED from here. I had the gov'nor omelet and the French toast for brunch, which we all presented beautifully but I threw up my guts last night and that was the only thing I ate yesterday.

Great bar, friendly bartender and owner. They dont seem to be honoring their happy hour deals right now so beers are $8 as are well drinks.  Didnt try the food as no one else was either plus entrees are about $18+. Good place for a drink if youre in the neighborhood.

So this was my first time eating here and lets just say its my last. We saw our server 2 times, once when he took the order and again when he took the bills to us. We waited an hour for our meal only for the order to be wrong. When the
First off the food was delicious!!! I got the steak and eggs everything tasted so good. The servers were so nice!!!! The atmosphere was great! I will most definitely be going back!!

For what it is, it's a decent restaurant. Presentation and ambiance were great, but I had higher expectations for the food given some of the prices. I tried the CK breakfast and french toast plate. Both tasted good and were averaged sized
Brunch was delicious and good service. Good place to be.
Bad Covid protocols, extremely rude, waiter was a pantsy

The restaurant was very quiet, in comparison to pre pandemic when it was almost always full. No complaints though, we were seated immediately at 730pm on a Friday night. Food is just as delicious as I recall. Really good mash on top of the shepherd's pie. Everything was solid.

I live near The Crooked Knife and ate there seven times over the years. I always ordered the burger with fries, because its one dish I would not make at home. All seven times the burger and fries were different. Burgers were generally not
Boozy Brunch is worth every $$$$.
Good attention and food.

Food Delicious (over a year ago)...but, we went back again yesterday and we had an issue with the reservation (even though I was on the list) the guy at the door told me if I confirmed the reservation...I said I spoke yesterday over the

So came here for the boozy brunch. The service was horrible to say the least.  First we get seated which was fine, but the server wasn't friendly or anything.  Then we got the food. My fiancee didn't touch her plate at all, the server never
Delicious food, great service, a go-to place for food with friends or coworkers
Waitress forgot a bit about us but intimate and fun place. The chicken was really good

I was refused service here today without reason other than "no tables". When asked if we could wait for an open table I was told "No, go to Mason Jar." Glad I did, food was delicious but does not exclude your bad behavior!

We ended our night here after a fun-filled day of exploring. We had a couple glasses of wine and chicken tenders, and they did not disappoint! Heavy pours on wine (yay) and the beer was good. Service was great, friendly, and fast. Would recommend!

Location stated that they were open & asked what time I wanted to schedule our brunch for.  Gave a time & was advised to head to the restaurant.  When we arrived, they were closed.  Please ask the customer to update their info online.
A fabulous restaurant. Never fails but to impress.
Excellent

The place is cute and they have bottomless which is nice. But the food is really not great at all. I went with 6 friends and tried everything and it all pretty much sucked. Avo toast ick, burger over cooked, omelets fake eggs, benedict
Great place to chill, get away, eat some good food. I will be bringing friends next time. Bring your hunger - portions are large.
Always a great meal at The Crooked Knife.   I never had anything that I didn't drool over.   The buttermilk fried chicken is amazing.   So is the burrata and the truffle fries.
The service here was beyond incredible and the food was amazing.

Had an amazing dinner at at The Crooked Knife celebrating a friends birthday! James C was a superb waiter who was very kind and attentive keeping our glasses full! The food was delicious highly recommend the rib eye steak and the salmon. We

This place requires reservation ahead, but is worth it. With all the amazing and flavorful food together with the incredible and super polite service provide by the people in there, fully recommended for any special events.
Excellent service and food to die for.
Food was great, staff was super attentive.
Fantastic service
Limited menu and super strict food substitutions rules.
Food was really good, drinks were reasonable and you get what you pay for. Ordered Bacardi and that's what I got, no switcheroo here! Good times
Good service

Celebrated a birthday brunch here. Very accommodating staff and meals were great (a nice-sized portion too). For the sized party we were I'm glad we were able to enjoy ourselves and find that the bill was also reasonable!! The Crooked Knife

We did the boozy brunch with 20 people. Tje staff were so kind and patient with our large group and the mimosas never stopped coming until last call. It was a great brunch. I had the beef short rib Benedict, but loved that there were lots
Very nice place to eat and have a beer
Great service food excellent
Awesome bar, Super comfortable and the beers on tap are dope!Definitely worth a visit!
Outstanding boozy brunch, the servers are great too.
Went for unlimited brunch... great staff and they kept the Mimosas comingFood was just average and I would have rather a bigger portion of food but it was good enough
Happy hour red wine. Nuff said.
The worst bartenders I ever met. They werent attentive. I was given the wrong wine  and didnt refund. Their loyalty to the consumer is awful.Zero star
Cute decor. Great service! Their Bloody Mary's leave something to be desired though. Stick with the mimosas
Food and atmosphere were great. Tables were a bit cramped.
Had fish n fries, decent food. Good coffee, staff good, but location smelt like pee and ash trays. Weird.
A nice pub to grab a beer or a bite.

love this place. best happy hour spot in the neighborhood. excellent dirty martinis, old fashions and moscow mules. dining room is cozy with the fireplace but roomy enough for big group of people. The food is great:  burgers and fries, tomato soup and grilled cheese fish n chips, kale and salmon salad and shepherds pie.

Great spot for a boozy brunch and a none boozy brunch. I went with a large group all of us opted out of the boozy brunch but we did not feel like second class citizen because of it. Make a reservation in advance, it seemed unlikely that you would get a table as a walk-in on the weekend.
Good food.
Delicious. Friendly staff. Smaller portions for the price, though.
Its fine. Menu is limited, food is not bad. Wouldnt go out of my way to come back but not a bad option if youre in the area.
Awesome
Awesome place, food and drinks were excellent
Great pub - great variety of beers
They definitely do brunch well
Vicky is the best

Great place to have lunch, dinner or just a beer. Great food, the dishes are well prepared and of good quality, with a good quality / price ratio. The location is very nice and the staff are super friendly, there is a
Great Irish pub & good staff
Love this place, heavy handed brunch . Service is great! #boozybrunch41
Awesome service. Great food.
This was a perfect place for dinner after a long hot day walking in NYC.  Loves the decor and the staff was great.  Loved the food.
They put England/USA world cup (ladies) football on the TV for us...Great bar !!!! (PS were supporting England)
Flippin great measures!

Old time style place around the 30s street in Manhattan. Definitely pricey as expected. Menu looked good but not filling. The bar is old and the chairs are comfortable, definitely a nice place to spend time and chatting with people at the bar, if you don't mind the $9 Guinness punt.
Bad food. This place is all about bottomless drinks and socializing.
Loved it!!

A nice brunch place with a smaller menu. The decor is neighborhood bar/home-feel. The service was pretty good and the food was good quality with nice presentation. I got the avocado toast which comes comes with a side salad...it's actually a big portion and should fill you up.
Best restaurant I have ever eaten at. I had the best server..Justin. I loved everything
Fun place for Brunch in NY.
I came here for a friends birthday brunch and the atmosphere is nice. The waitress was attentive and witty. My chicken sandwich was dry though.
Chicken sandwich and fries were good. Decent happy hour spot
Comfy, homey spot w good comfort food good drinks and nice staff
I love the food here and ambiance! Mike the manager (also our buddy (& the block mayor lol) is a gem and makes the place warm, friendly, and very Irish which I love
Great food, amazing happy hour deals
Great place, great service awesome food Disgusting bathrooms I ever seen, worse then a night club on a Saturday night. Get a rest room attendant.
Not bad, pretty relaxed but drinks are expensive
Chicken tenders are unbelievable! Server Sabina is awesome, so funny and knowledgeable about the menu! Had excellent time:) highly recommend the daffodil cocktail. It's so good!!!
Good place to eat  Don't forget the cheese cake it is one of the best that I ever tried.
Eggs Benedict, mimosas and good company. Not loving the 5 minute warning after 2 hours of enjoying the place. But you can stay at the bar if you really want to.
The food was good. James our server was great. The brussel sprouts were astounding!

I wish my fried chicken sandwich was more fried instead of loosely coated with greasy bread crumbs. My drink was really good though and I would have ordered another one if my server had come to check up on us.

This was a random goldmine find during a work trip to the city. We were looking for a place for dinner and everything was packed, but walking around we saw this place and decided to stop by with the great surprise of getting an amazing

The food was good but the seating arrangement felt a little odd. There were only a couple of tables that offered any sense of separation from other tables. All the other tables were arranged wherever they could find space. Not an ideal place for a date or a group outing.
Amazing food! Had chicken and sliders and both were on part with much more expensive places. Laid back vibe and great service
Amazing Brunch very loud but good energy!!! And their happy hour is eternal during the week !!!!!
Great food, weak drinks.
McKenna is a literal angel. We had a huge bachelorette brunch and she took such great care of us. Next time were in New York well for sure come back here!
Nice secluded resturant
kind of expensive for what it is, but a nice place to meet up with friends for some snacks and a drink
Cozy spot with delicious foods! Great brunch spot
Great 2 hour bottomless brunch with friends
Nice atmosphere, mediocre food, subpar service
A large group of us went for a birthday brunch early one weekend. Most of us got the boozy brunch: 2 hours of unlimited Mimosa or Bloody Mary, or so we thought.
Nice place
Great place with great atmosphere and great food

Love the set up of the place. So cozy and homely in my opinion lol. Its not everyones cup of tea. Delicious cocktails! Waitress was really friendly too. Took the time to explain what specialty cocktails they can make with the remaining ingredients the bar had.
Loved it!
Very fancy place.

Exceptional chicken strips, great service. Our toddler was a bit much to handle on a recent afternoon visit, and our server was gracious and helpful. Very nice spot, cozy and warm with fireplaces. Would visit again, if they would have us.
Nice place. Ok mad. We only got a little. Can pay by card. Sweet service
Great food, great service great atmosphere.
Solid NYC bar with good food options and friendly staff.
Very fancy place.
Ok , but nothing special , good and friendly though.
Great brunch specials!! The server was really nice
Excellent excellent excellent!!
Amazing vibe and music. Great food.

Pretty good brunch for NYC, although a little pricey for what you get. The bottomless comes option comes with so many rules, you may need your lawyer to come with you... so hopefully you like that person.
Good brunch option, nice patio.
Great neighborhood pub. Always drink specials.  One of the better Burger in NYC.
Excellent place to hang out or for a date!
Great food and service.   Will be back.
#foodcoma great experience
Great atmosphere and friendly staff. Food was good and not expensive for NYC

When the food finally arrived, it was good however we asked for a drinks menu, NO, iced latte? NO, regular latte?, NO..we just have coffee!Umm ok, so we got a mimosa and an Orange juice. The juice? Couldnt call it a juice at all..it was a watered down, barely orange flavoured cordial at best.
A little loud but other than that it was great
My first New York strip steak in New York. Medium rare and well done! Central location and nice atmosphere.
Great service
Sunday Brunch is amazing!! The lunch in the week is good.

The Brunch food was delicious. Get the biscuits and gravy. The service was horrid. One brunch server for 20+ tables on the last day of World Cup. They don't split checks (c'mon, it's 2018) unless they forget to ring in your order, after
Good brunch!
Great service. Good food. Little loud. Nice ambience.
I really liked the service at Brunch, but having the head chef yell at an employee was not enjoyable and ruined a rather good service.
Relaxing and friendly service

[brunch review] The bottomless brunch is a little on the pricey side ($43) The menu needs retooling. I had a "Hangover salad" with hashbrowns, bacon etc for $18. It looked like they used the scraps from the rest of the dishes my group
Excellent food and excellent service.

I made a reservation a week ahead of time and granted it was during Pride but the restaurant was NOT packed -we were seated and then nobody came to our table for 15 minutes. I had to get up and find the host to remind him that we'd been
Great spot for a date or hanging with friends
Glad there is a nice irish pub in my neighborhood, I try to go here at least a couple of times a month.  Great relaxed atmosphere, good when you just want to get away for a while.
Good food, friendly service! I was surprised, the waitress speaks also finnish. :D
The food is good, the staff even better.
Fun environment the wedding party next to us was live
Came for an unexpected brunch. Good food. Will be back to see more of the menu.
Our server McKenna was the sweetest! Amazing service and amazing food! 10/10 would recommend

Came here for our anniversary. The atmosphere is lovely. I ate shrimp linguine which was delicious. We saw a prix fixe menu on the website which we asked about, only for the manager to greet us and explain that they don't do it anymore.
Good food...
Great!!! Friendly food is really great! Try the salmon.. It's exceptional! New facf place
Avocado Toast!!!
Great food. Loved it, but couldn't hold a conversation, it was too loud

[Brunch Review] I love this place so much-- it's my go-to brunch spot when I have visitors or a big group! It's spacious, the food is delicious, and the service is awesome. They have a boozy brunch deal where you pay $43 and you can get any
Service was good for brunch and meals were delicious.
Amazing service and food!!!#
Good food - friendly service
Philip was Amazing!
Food was good and the bottomless mimosas deadly
Good service great boozy brunch.
I work in midtown and this place is great for lunch.

I've been here twice - first to have a beer and soup with a friend - and I was shocked at how gourmet and tasty the soup was.  The second time I invited several friends and we tried half the menu - everything was great.  Service could be a little more attentive, but otherwise, really great.
Fun for brunch. The unlimited deal is good. Food was okay, standard for a weekend brunch.
Get food chill atmosphere!

I went for a boozy unlimited brunch with about 10 friends.  The restaurant was very accomodating, the drinks were flowing, and my steak and eggs was excellent and cooked to the right temperature.  I would recommend for groups who want to feast on mimosas and bloody marys.
My friends and I had a wonderful evening Great food, friendly waitress Great recommendations all three dishes were fabulous Lovely atmosphere. Well go by again for sure
Delicious food, great coffee and service, large co.dortable bar area, very loud
Nice place and with good service. Good food and fair price.

Great place for brunch, especially in Manhattan. Price is good, not too expensive, and food is good for the price. Two hour limit on endless drinks, but thats pretty standard in NYC. Drink selection isnt vast, but they do keep pouring for you!
Great for what it is... A bottomless brunch spot.

Food was good, however the service wasnt. Had gratuity put on my bill for our party of two...even though it clearly says on the menu it will be added for parties of six or more.  Not sure if it was a mistake or purposeful to get more money from us.  Check your bill!
Possibly the best bartender there would be Phillip. He was more than welcoming and deserves a raise

Service isnt good for a big group. They can automatically charge the service fee without providing good or any service. I would not do bottomless. Drinks are terrible and server doesnt come around. Actually the only time he comes around is to tell you when you need to leave. Manu is also limited for bottomless. Dont do it!
Horrible service.  Over priced with not so good food quality.

Went for a Saturday brunch expecting a good brunch with a friend from out of town but the drinks are 100% definitely watered during brunch - had MANY bloody Marys but this was the absolute worst Ive ever had tasted like water and vodka no

They must have hired a new Chef because the menu has changed in the past year or so. I used to be able to get great calamari there but they don't have that on the menu anymore and it seems like they're going for more of a upper class fare.
Good food, great service, cozy. Went three times in a week.
fun place, great staff, and strong drinks!
Nice atmosphere and wonderful service.  I will definitely be eating here again.

Terrible bar.  This place has a rowdy, out-of-town, crowd.  I grabbed a drink around midnight with a friend on a weekday, and the people in the bar area were creating a ruckus.  Several people were drunk and shouting at each other, which
Didn't like this place much. Came for bottomless brunch, it was mediocre. Food was okay, whatever champagne they used made me and my friend feel sick.
Ok
Lovely surf and turf
